summary: The bill, titled the Supporting all Healthy Options when Purchasing Produce Act of 2025 (SHOPP Act of 2025), aims to amend the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008. It focuses on expanding access to nutrition incentives under the Gus Schumacher Nutrition Incentive Program. Key provisions include increasing year-round availability of incentives by including fresh frozen fruits and vegetables and broadening the scope of eligible foods to include legumes. The bill seeks to improve food security and healthy eating options for families.
